intro: Plagiobothrys divergens, commonly known as the diverging bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The species is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and linear, hairy leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Plagiobothrys divergens is an annual plant that produces small, round pods containing several seeds.
